Example 6.2 from Experimental Design & Analysis for Tree Improvement

Source: R/Exam6.2.R
Exam6.2.Rd

Exam 6.2 Dbh mean, Dbh varince and number of trees per plot from 3 provinces("PNG","Sabah","Queensland") with 4 replications of 48 families.

References

  1. Williams, E.R., Matheson, A.C. and Harwood, C.E. (2002).Experimental Design and Analysis for Tree Improvement. CSIRO Publishing.

See also

DataExam6.2

Examples

data(DataExam6.2)
library(tidyverse)
library(lme4)

DataExam6.2.1 <- DataExam6.2[DataExam6.2$Province=="PNG",]
fm6.3 <- lm(formula      =
        Dbh.mean        ~ Replication+Family
        ,data           = DataExam6.2.1
       #, subset
       #, weights
       #, na.action
        , method      = "qr"
        , model       = TRUE
        , x           = FALSE
        , y           = FALSE
        , qr          = TRUE
        , singular.ok = TRUE
        , contrasts   = NULL
       )
b    <- anova(fm6.3)
print(b)
#> Analysis of Variance Table
#> 
#> Response: Dbh.mean
#>              Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value   Pr(>F)   
#> Replication   3  11.122  3.7073  3.1776 0.026614 * 
#> Family       40  88.018  2.2005  1.8861 0.004531 **
#> Residuals   120 140.004  1.1667                    
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1
HM      <- function(x){length(x)/sum(1/x)}
w       <- HM(DataExam6.2.1$Dbh.count)
S2      <- b[["Mean Sq"]][length(b[["Mean Sq"]])]
Sigma2t <- mean(DataExam6.2.1$Dbh.variance)
sigma2m <- S2-(Sigma2t/w)
fm6.3.1<- lmer(formula=
     Dbh.mean ~ 1+Replication+(1|Family)
    ,data = DataExam6.2.1
    ,REML = TRUE
    ,control = lmerControl()
    ,start = NULL
    , verbose = 0L
   #, subset
   #, weights
   #, na.action
   #,offset
    , contrasts = NULL
    , devFunOnly = FALSE)
summary(fm6.3.1)
#> Linear mixed model fit by REML ['lmerMod']
#> Formula: Dbh.mean ~ 1 + Replication + (1 | Family)
#>    Data: DataExam6.2.1
#> 
#> REML criterion at convergence: 519
#> 
#> Scaled residuals: 
#>      Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
#> -2.88039 -0.58138  0.00457  0.60595  2.07527 
#> 
#> Random effects:
#>  Groups   Name        Variance Std.Dev.
#>  Family   (Intercept) 0.2584   0.5084  
#>  Residual             1.1667   1.0801  
#> Number of obs: 164, groups:  Family, 41
#> 
#> Fixed effects:
#>              Estimate Std. Error t value
#> (Intercept)  14.38829    0.18644  77.174
#> Replication2 -0.15561    0.23856  -0.652
#> Replication3 -0.60951    0.23856  -2.555
#> Replication4  0.05195    0.23856   0.218
#> 
#> Correlation of Fixed Effects:
#>             (Intr) Rplct2 Rplct3
#> Replicatin2 -0.640              
#> Replicatin3 -0.640  0.500       
#> Replicatin4 -0.640  0.500  0.500
print(VarCorr(fm6.3.1),comp=c("Variance"))
#>  Groups   Name        Variance
#>  Family   (Intercept) 0.25844 
#>  Residual             1.16670 
sigma2f <- 0.2584
h2 <- (sigma2f/(0.3))/(Sigma2t+sigma2m+sigma2f)
cbind(w,Sigma2t,sigma2m,sigma2f,h2)
#>             w  Sigma2t   sigma2m sigma2f        h2
#> [1,] 4.408602 3.920732 0.2773606  0.2584 0.1932761

print("Dbh Heritability for all the Provinces")
#> [1] "Dbh Heritability for all the Provinces"
fm6.4 <- lm(formula      =
        Dbh.mean        ~ Replication+Family
        ,data           = DataExam6.2
       #, subset
       #, weights
       #, na.action
        , method      = "qr"
        , model       = TRUE
        , x           = FALSE
        , y           = FALSE
        , qr          = TRUE
        , singular.ok = TRUE
        , contrasts   = NULL
       )
b    <- anova(fm6.4)
print(b)
#> Analysis of Variance Table
#> 
#> Response: Dbh.mean
#>              Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
#> Replication   3   8.769  2.9230  2.6692   0.04997 *  
#> Family       47 214.728  4.5687  4.1721 2.885e-11 ***
#> Residuals   141 154.405  1.0951                      
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1
HM      <- function(x){length(x)/sum(1/x)}
w       <- HM(DataExam6.2$Dbh.count)
S2      <- b[["Mean Sq"]][length(b[["Mean Sq"]])]
Sigma2t <- mean(DataExam6.2$Dbh.variance)
sigma2m <- S2-(Sigma2t/w)
fm6.4.1<- lmer(formula=
     Dbh.mean ~ 1+Replication+Province+(1|Family)
    ,data = DataExam6.2
    ,REML = TRUE
    ,control = lmerControl()
    ,start = NULL
    , verbose = 0L
   #, subset
   #, weights
   #, na.action
   #,offset
    , contrasts = NULL
    , devFunOnly = FALSE)
summary(fm6.4.1)
#> Linear mixed model fit by REML ['lmerMod']
#> Formula: Dbh.mean ~ 1 + Replication + Province + (1 | Family)
#>    Data: DataExam6.2
#> 
#> REML criterion at convergence: 602.3
#> 
#> Scaled residuals: 
#>      Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
#> -2.85944 -0.56725 -0.00966  0.59971  2.14173 
#> 
#> Random effects:
#>  Groups   Name        Variance Std.Dev.
#>  Family   (Intercept) 0.3514   0.5928  
#>  Residual             1.0951   1.0465  
#> Number of obs: 192, groups:  Family, 48
#> 
#> Fixed effects:
#>               Estimate Std. Error t value
#> (Intercept)    14.3356     0.1799  79.693
#> Replication2   -0.1119     0.2136  -0.524
#> Replication3   -0.4754     0.2136  -2.226
#> Replication4    0.0850     0.2136   0.398
#> ProvinceSabah  -0.9237     0.5726  -1.613
#> ProvinceQLD    -2.3540     0.3745  -6.285
#> 
#> Correlation of Fixed Effects:
#>             (Intr) Rplct2 Rplct3 Rplct4 PrvncS
#> Replicatin2 -0.594                            
#> Replicatin3 -0.594  0.500                     
#> Replicatin4 -0.594  0.500  0.500              
#> ProvinceSbh -0.148  0.000  0.000  0.000       
#> ProvinceQLD -0.226  0.000  0.000  0.000  0.071
print(VarCorr(fm6.4.1),comp=c("Variance"))
#>  Groups   Name        Variance
#>  Family   (Intercept) 0.35139 
#>  Residual             1.09507 
sigma2f <- 0.3514
h2 <- (sigma2f/(0.3))/(Sigma2t+sigma2m+sigma2f)
cbind(w,Sigma2t,sigma2m,sigma2f,h2)
#>             w  Sigma2t  sigma2m sigma2f        h2
#> [1,] 4.451314 3.860156 0.227873  0.3514 0.2638477
print("Genetic Correlation Between Dbh and Height for PNG Province")
#> [1] "Genetic Correlation Between Dbh and Height for PNG Province"
fm6.7.1<- lmer(formula=
     Dbh.mean ~ 1+Replication+(1|Family)
    ,data = DataExam6.2.1
    ,REML = TRUE
    ,control = lmerControl()
    ,start = NULL
    , verbose = 0L
   #, subset
   #, weights
   #, na.action
   #,offset
    , contrasts = NULL
    , devFunOnly = FALSE)
summary(fm6.7.1)
#> Linear mixed model fit by REML ['lmerMod']
#> Formula: Dbh.mean ~ 1 + Replication + (1 | Family)
#>    Data: DataExam6.2.1
#> 
#> REML criterion at convergence: 519
#> 
#> Scaled residuals: 
#>      Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
#> -2.88039 -0.58138  0.00457  0.60595  2.07527 
#> 
#> Random effects:
#>  Groups   Name        Variance Std.Dev.
#>  Family   (Intercept) 0.2584   0.5084  
#>  Residual             1.1667   1.0801  
#> Number of obs: 164, groups:  Family, 41
#> 
#> Fixed effects:
#>              Estimate Std. Error t value
#> (Intercept)  14.38829    0.18644  77.174
#> Replication2 -0.15561    0.23856  -0.652
#> Replication3 -0.60951    0.23856  -2.555
#> Replication4  0.05195    0.23856   0.218
#> 
#> Correlation of Fixed Effects:
#>             (Intr) Rplct2 Rplct3
#> Replicatin2 -0.640              
#> Replicatin3 -0.640  0.500       
#> Replicatin4 -0.640  0.500  0.500
print(VarCorr(fm6.7.1),comp=c("Variance"))
#>  Groups   Name        Variance
#>  Family   (Intercept) 0.25844 
#>  Residual             1.16670 
sigma2f[1] <- 0.2584

fm6.7.2<- lmer(formula=
     Ht.mean ~ 1+Replication+(1|Family)
    ,data = DataExam6.2.1
    ,REML = TRUE
    ,control = lmerControl()
    ,start = NULL
    , verbose = 0L
   #, subset
   #, weights
   #, na.action
   #,offset
    , contrasts = NULL
    , devFunOnly = FALSE)
summary(fm6.7.2)
#> Linear mixed model fit by REML ['lmerMod']
#> Formula: Ht.mean ~ 1 + Replication + (1 | Family)
#>    Data: DataExam6.2.1
#> 
#> REML criterion at convergence: 505.8
#> 
#> Scaled residuals: 
#>      Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
#> -3.12570 -0.52588  0.04163  0.63270  2.81217 
#> 
#> Random effects:
#>  Groups   Name        Variance Std.Dev.
#>  Family   (Intercept) 0.2711   0.5207  
#>  Residual             1.0549   1.0271  
#> Number of obs: 164, groups:  Family, 41
#> 
#> Fixed effects:
#>              Estimate Std. Error t value
#> (Intercept)   11.6839     0.1798  64.968
#> Replication2   0.2761     0.2268   1.217
#> Replication3   0.6227     0.2268   2.745
#> Replication4   1.9320     0.2268   8.516
#> 
#> Correlation of Fixed Effects:
#>             (Intr) Rplct2 Rplct3
#> Replicatin2 -0.631              
#> Replicatin3 -0.631  0.500       
#> Replicatin4 -0.631  0.500  0.500
print(VarCorr(fm6.7.2),comp=c("Variance"))
#>  Groups   Name        Variance
#>  Family   (Intercept) 0.27111 
#>  Residual             1.05494 
sigma2f[2] <- 0.2711

fm6.7.3<- lmer(formula=
     Sum.means ~ 1+Replication+(1|Family)
    ,data = DataExam6.2.1
    ,REML = TRUE
    ,control = lmerControl()
    ,start = NULL
    , verbose = 0L
   #, subset
   #, weights
   #, na.action
   #,offset
    , contrasts = NULL
    , devFunOnly = FALSE)
summary(fm6.7.3)
#> Linear mixed model fit by REML ['lmerMod']
#> Formula: Sum.means ~ 1 + Replication + (1 | Family)
#>    Data: DataExam6.2.1
#> 
#> REML criterion at convergence: 686.4
#> 
#> Scaled residuals: 
#>      Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
#> -3.15407 -0.50211 -0.02361  0.55745  2.61472 
#> 
#> Random effects:
#>  Groups   Name        Variance Std.Dev.
#>  Family   (Intercept) 0.8729   0.9343  
#>  Residual             3.2428   1.8008  
#> Number of obs: 164, groups:  Family, 41
#> 
#> Fixed effects:
#>              Estimate Std. Error t value
#> (Intercept)  26.07220    0.31683  82.290
#> Replication2  0.12049    0.39773   0.303
#> Replication3  0.01317    0.39773   0.033
#> Replication4  1.98390    0.39773   4.988
#> 
#> Correlation of Fixed Effects:
#>             (Intr) Rplct2 Rplct3
#> Replicatin2 -0.628              
#> Replicatin3 -0.628  0.500       
#> Replicatin4 -0.628  0.500  0.500
print(VarCorr(fm6.7.3),comp=c("Variance"))
#>  Groups   Name        Variance
#>  Family   (Intercept) 0.87292 
#>  Residual             3.24281 
sigma2f[3] <- 0.873
sigma2xy    <- 0.5*(sigma2f[3]-sigma2f[1]-sigma2f[2])
GenCorr <- sigma2xy/sqrt(sigma2f[1]*sigma2f[2])
cbind(S2x=sigma2f[1],S2y=sigma2f[2],S2.x.plus.y=sigma2f[3],GenCorr)
#>         S2x    S2y S2.x.plus.y   GenCorr
#> [1,] 0.2584 0.2711       0.873 0.6489119
